file_content.text: I'm prepared to accept the consequences of failure, Jedi.
After the Corellian government "betrayed" their people, the consequences of a Republic victory will be preying on their minds.
So, with two Guardian Holds reclaimed, Corellia's key officials will be hiding in Guardian Hold One. The First Son has likely joined them.
Your assistance will not go unrewarded, General.
Thank you. I'll remember this.
We should see what the situation is in Capitol Square.
Send a scout ahead.
A commando will see.
I have no interest in being sent on a wild bantha chase.
"Likely"? Not good enough.
We must be sure. A commando will see.
Another of us dead because of you. It's tragic--both Daresha's loss, and your failure.
A true Jedi Master could have guided her back to the light.
By the same logic, you too could turn from this darkness.
Then there's hope for you.
I think you overestimate your powers.
Such violence. Is your devotion to balance finally slipping away?
Removing the Children of the Emperor will return Corellia to its rightful state.
I'm restoring the status quo.
A noble idea, but sloppy methodology.
Your ruthlessness couldn't stop your troops from dying. However do you hope to win this war?
Remember, Master. You are Syo Bakarn, descended from the ancient Bakvalens here on Corellia.
I know about your family, Syo.
Yes. I remember... my father and I, walking Axial Park. He said, "Syo, we were... once...."
No. I have no father but the Emperor.
The First Son does not speak for you, Master. Your mind is your own. Use it.
And your analysis, Master Syo?
You... do the Jedi credit. You must fight. And I, I will....
Be silent.
One of your generals has just been quite helpful.
Your own men are turning.
I imagine that amuses you.
Your death will bring peace.
By killing you.
"One more death and the galaxy will be perfect." I see.
Dozens of my brothers and sisters still lie in wait. Even the best hunter's arrow only strikes once. You are going to your death.
You're reaching him, Jedi. Whatever nonsense the First Son says.
Hunter's arrow. Jedi, back home, the Hunter's Arrow is the biggest tower in our capital. Do you think he meant something by that?
He was using a figure of speech, nothing more.
I doubt it.
Striking while our forces are committed here is sound strategy, if it's true.
An attack would make sense.
And if you think that, so will he.
Don't leap to conclusions.
Just a minute. Holiday, these are the codes for my world's long-range alert beacons. Can you slice in and check them?
Connecting. Hmm. Beacon 312 just picked up a fleet entering the local asteroid belt. But the fleet had a Jedi authorization.
Your people would have no reason to challenge a Jedi code.
So nobody questioned it.
I think I can guess whose authorization that fleet used.
From Master Syo?
First, let's be sure the fleet's not actually some Republic task force.
It could still be innocent.
The brass may not be bright, but they don't send out task forces for no reason.
An attack. Okay. Okay. The Empire won't know the shortcuts through the asteroid belt--I do. We can still send help.
The Esh-kha are still fresh. If we sent them right now, they could get there in time.
Don't you see? The First Son did this deliberately; he wants me to send our reserve forces away.
I can't, it's what he wants.
If Corellia falls, we lose everything. The Republic must come first.
No, I need those troops.
So we save Corellia, but it's okay if my home's destroyed?
You stopped me from avenging my father. Now this. I'm not holding back again.
You can't do it, can you? Not even for me.
Holiday, please make the beacons send a warning. And add that I'm on my way to help the defense.
Your people already have a military and experts to lead it.
You're being irrational.
No one back home knows about fighting the Empire. Without your help, they'll need mine. Goodbye, Master.
Corellia needs you. So do I.
Please don't leave.
This isn't about us. I can't abandon my people, even for you.
As a Jedi, your place is by my side, protecting this world.
You belong here, Padawan.
The First Son is attacking them because father and I came with you. Sorry, Master. I have to disobey.
May the Force protect you and your people.
Then go with my blessing.
Thank you, Master. And good luck.
What a nightmare. Poor Nadia.
It's still my duty to protect the Rift Alliance worlds. I'll give the order.
All right, I'll send them.
Holiday, please trigger the beacons--tell everyone back home what's happening, and help's coming.
Thank you. But I should go with them. I know the asteroids and our defenses. You'll be alright, won't you?
Your talents could still save many lives.
You're leaving?
You have everyone you need. And I'll take good care of your troops.
Stay on Corellia, I need to know you're safe.
You shouldn't go.
I'll be fighting for you, too. We both have our duty. Don't let him win.
Don't worry about us. Go, help your people.
We'll be fine.
Remember, guard your communications, and don't let them lure you onto open battlefields.
Focus on defending your world.
I'll keep asking myself what you'd do. They won't get past us, I promise.
Small thing is bigger than she looks.
Leave these "generals" for the Republic. Reaching Guardian Hold One will be tough without fresh troops.
Leave these "generals" for the Republic. Got Guardian Hold One to handle.
Let's discuss terms, gentlemen.
Position's secure. Picked trustworthy guards, security grid's being fixed.
The Imperial Guard will soon return. You can't survive another onslaught!
We only need to hold this position until the First Son is found.
I don't have to.
You know who I'm looking for. Are you going to cooperate?
I want the First Son.
Yes. We are.
You're now prisoners of the Republic. Ask yourselves: Will the First Son risk leaving you alive?
Neither could you.
We're prepared to be reasonable, Jedi.
What are you doing?
Merion, she just defeated Imperial Guardsmen and a Child of the Emperor. Think.
Merion, he just defeated Imperial Guardsmen and a Child of the Emperor. Think.
We don't know where the First Son is. But there's a government bunker below Capitol Square that's been transmitting our orders. The Republic calls it Guardian Hold One.
The Sith will crush you for this, Grann!
We have plenty of Voss commandos. Gaden-Ko can stay with you; if they leave right now, they could get there in time.
We haven't really used the droids. If we send them now, they might get there in time.
We have a survey droid left, it can go.
All shall be inscribed on a warrior's eyes, and laid at your feet.
We should cut through the shadows. A warrior will test these waters.
We should scout Capitol Square first. We have a spare survey droid.
Looking good. The security grid's being repaired; the Republic's pulling troops back in from across the park.
Let's leave our new friends here for the Republic. We have to focus on cracking Guardian Hold One, without reinforcements.
We can leave our new friends here for the Republic. Let's work on Guardian Hold One.
